snippet: One of Tom Stoppard’s more challenging plays, “Travesties" follows the addled memories of a British consular recalling his days in Zurich during World War I. The show runs through July 20 at the Bay Street Theater in Sag Harbor.
abstract: Aileen Jacobson reviews Tom Stoppard play Travesties at Bay Street Theater in Sag Harbor; directed by Gregory Boyd, productions stars Richard Kind along with Andrew Weems, Michael Benz, Julia Motyka, Emily Trask and Isabel Keating (Metropolitan/Long Island).
lead_paragraph: One of Tom Stoppard’s more challenging plays, “Travesties" follows the addled memories of a British consular recalling his days in Zurich during World War I. The show runs through July 20 at the Bay Street Theater in Sag Harbor.
